traffic signs.description: On the right side of the road, there is a yield sign for parking.
traffic signs.explanation: This sign indicates that vehicles must stop outside the stop line to look around and confirm it is safe before proceeding.

traffic signs.description: There is a blue sign on the upper right with an upward arrow.
traffic signs.explanation: This sign provides drivers with route information.

other objects.description: The bicycle parked on the right side of the sidewalk by the road.
other objects.explanation: Although they are not directly on the lane, the presence of numerous bicycles indicates that this is a busy area, where pedestrians or cyclists might affect the driving decisions of autonomous vehicles.

general_perception.description and explanation: The image presents two traffic signs. The first is a yield sign located on the right side of the road, signifying that vehicles should stop at the stop line to ensure their surroundings are safe before proceeding. The second is a blue directional sign placed on the upper right with an upward arrow, providing drivers with the necessary route information. Additionally, there are bicycles parked on the sidewalk by the road, indicating that the area is bustling with pedestrians or cyclists, potentially impacting the driving behavior of autonomous vehicles.

driving_suggestion: Reduce speed due to wet and slippery road surface. Pay attention to the stop and yield signs, and you must stop and look out beyond the stop line. Only after confirming safety, you are allowed to proceed. Be aware of potential unexpected movements around parked bicycles, and watch out for any cyclists or pedestrians that might appear. Be vigilant of possible road work or obstacles indicated by traffic cones ahead. Exercise caution due to the potential unpredictable behavior of dogs. Stay alert for pedestrians or cyclists who may enter the roadway from the sidewalk area where bicycles are parked. Keep a safe distance from traffic cones and avoid the restricted areas they may indicate. Watch for dogs by the roadside in case they suddenly run onto the road. Observe any further road signs or changes in road conditions. Maintain your lane and stay away from areas marked by traffic cones. Be mindful of cyclists that may enter the road at bicycle parking spots.

1.description and explanation: This is an animal, specifically a dog, that appears to be walking or standing near the curb of the road. The presence of this animal is a potential hazard for the driver of the ego car. The driver should reduce speed, remain vigilant, and be prepared to stop or maneuver carefully to avoid any possible interaction with the animal, as it may unpredictably enter the roadway.
